qas.question: Who can put a stop the parliamentary attempts at dissovling itself in some areas?
If the head of state prevents the dissolution of parliament, what needs to happen?

answers.text: resignation of the prime minister and his or her government

qas.question: In contemporary parliamentary governments, which official is usually in charge of asking parliament to dissolve?
who has the power to disolve parliment?
Who can the prime minister damand a resignation from?
what kind of dissalution can parliment request?

context: The latter in effect allows the government to appeal the opposition of parliament to the electorate. However, in many jurisdictions a <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>head of state<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> may refuse a parliamentary dissolution, requiring the <a1_0>resignation of the <a2_0>prime minister<a2_0/> and his or her government<a1_0/>. In most modern parliamentary systems, the prime minister is the person who decides when to request a <b5_0>parliamentary dissolution<b5_0/>.
